txt.en: 'As I peer into the abyss my mind begins to cloud. There is both shadow and madness down there. I fear our only option is to enter the pit and hope to bide us some time until the seal can be repaired. If you are not able, I understand, and will send some of my best warriors instead. What choice do I have? If nothing is done, doom is certain.'\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: This is an extreme challenge instance suited for a 3-Man Small Fellowship. Proceed at your own risk!</rgb>
'You have done a great service to all in the Iron Hills. Songs will be sung of this day and Grár may finally be laid to rest.'
Náin can be found in Járnfast.\n\nYou should talk to Náin.
'You have done a great service to all in the Iron Hills. Songs will be sung of this day and Grár may finally be laid to rest.'
Deep under Járnfast, chief fortress of the Iron Hills, is a place where the red stone once cracked, revealing a horrible abyss beneath the Dwarf-halls.
Náin can be found at the entrance to the Howling Pit in Járnfast.\n\nYou should talk to Náin.
'Now is the time to finish what Grár began when he gave his life for us! If you find any sign of Grár, bring it to me.'
